articles.title: Path to 1000 IQ SuperIntelligence by 2030 Using Better Chips and Gigawatts of Power
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: Grok 2 was released in August 2024 and 6 months later Grok 3 was released with a 15X increase in AI training compute. People were expecting 10,000 times more compute but now there is path to getting much more. XAI has installed another 100,000 gPUs. There is 2.5 times the compute. There are 200,000 chips and power for them. xAI can double the power with gas turbines to 490 MW to power 400,000 B200s.

articles.title: Humanoid robots are on the march. Here are some of the most eyebrow-raising demo videos ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: AI has triggered rapid advancements in the world of robotics. Companies are developing humanoid robots that can do chores or provide intimacy. Here are some examples of products and services that could be developed using AI technology.    i.e. an AI-powered robot interacts with people during Italian Tech Week.

articles.title: The Intersection of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Cryptocurrencies: A New Era in Digital Finance
articles.author: Stephanie Maris
articles.summary: The rise of cryptocurrencies has transformed the way we think about money, transactions, and global finance. Artificial intelligence (AI) has made tremendous strides in nearly every industry. In this article, we explore how AI is influencing the world of cryptocurrencies and what the future holds for this exciting intersection.

articles.title: Can AMD Stock Surge to $170? Here's What This Top Analyst Expects
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) shares are down 32% over the past 12 months. The company's AI chip opportunity is slipping away, but Benchmark's top analyst Cody Acree remains in the bull camp, issuing a Buy rating on AMD shares and setting a $170 price target.

articles.title: Humanoid robots are on the march. Here are some of the most eyebrow-raising demo videos out there right now.
articles.summary: Recent demo videos show how robots are beginning to look and behave like humans. Some of the new humanoid robot designs are made to mimic a romantic partner. California-based Clone Robotics released a video last week showing its new Protoclone synthetic humanoid robot. On Friday, 1X Robotics posted a video of its NEO Gamma robot designed for household chores.

articles.title: Lancium's potential impact on AISD: Taxpayers could see reduction due to 'eye-popping' numbers
articles.author: Mariah Williams
articles.summary: The Lancium Campus, part of the Stargate Project, is projected to bring revenue to Abilene Independent School District. Texas law prevents the district's maintenance and operations budget from benefiting directly from the artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure. The district has already initiated internal discussions regarding the potential next steps.

articles.title: Humanoid robots are on the march. Here are some of the most eyebrow-raising demo videos out there right now.
articles.author: Kenneth Niemeyer
articles.summary: AI has triggered rapid advancements in the world of robotics. Companies are developing humanoid robots that can do chores or provide intimacy. Elon Musk expects humanoid AI robots to unlock "quasi-infinite products and services." Tesla plans to begin production on "several thousand" of its Optimus robots by the end of the year.

articles.title: How Long Before This Thing Is Roaming Around Exterminating People?
articles.author: Paul Joseph
articles.summary: A video of a humanoid automaton coming to life has gone viral on X. The synthetic human-like creature, named Clone Alpha, was created by a company called TRUTH LIVES on. It has a fully actuated lumbar spine and 910 muscle fibers under its'skin' for silent, lifelike movement.

articles.title: Westpac follows Commonwealth Bank in major AI change: 'Six days to one hour'
articles.author: Stewart Perrie
articles.summary: Westpac has been using AI-powered agents for software programming but is now looking at how the technology can be deployed across the business. Accenture is working with several banks across the globe to help them with customer service, sales, compliance and knowledge management. The Big Four banks are all dipping their toes into AI to see how it can transform the sector.

articles.title: AI Set to Revolutionize Blockchain Technology in 2025
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is set to revolutionize blockchain technology in 2025. AI-driven systems can process vast amounts of data, detect patterns, and make informed decisions far faster than humans. This convergence is transforming everything from finance to software development, bringing new levels of efficiency and intelligence to decentralized applications.

articles.title: Tales from the jar side: "Hidden" JSON fields from AI services, Giazotto vs Albinoni vs Bach/Gounod, and the usual toots and skeets
articles.author: Ken Kousen
articles.summary: This week Kousen taught his AI-Driven Manager course privately and gave a talk at the Atlanta Java Users Group. He's planning a video on accessing hidden values in AI responses. LangChain4j and Spring AI have a networking library built in and use the Jackson JSON API.

articles.title: Qatar lauded for its vision to be a global leader in AI-enabled government services
articles.author: Gulf-Times
articles.summary: Scale AI is partnering with MCIT in Qatar to enable the digital transformation of the Qatar government services in areas like education, healthcare and disaster response. The goal is to release and launch and scale up 50 AI-driven use cases by 2029, according to Alexandr Wang.

articles.title: OpenAI Researchers Find That Even the Best AI Is "Unable To Solve the Majority" of Coding Problems
articles.author: Noor Al-Sibai
articles.summary: Even the most advanced AI models can't solve the majority of coding tasks, according to OpenAI researchers. CEO Sam Altman insists they will be able to beat "low-level" software engineers by the end of this year. The models took on tasks worth hundreds of thousands of dollars on Upwork, but they were only able to fix surface-level software issues, while not finding bugs in larger projects.

articles.title: Jaishankar highlights India's AI potential and global role
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Jaishankar was speaking to students of the Indian Institute of Technology-BHU at the Pt Omkar in Varanasi. He said India has immense potential to harness the power of artificial intelligence and is ready to do so.

articles.title: Ditch the AI subscriptions and keep the premium features
articles.author: Natalie Nguyen
articles.summary: 1min.AI is an all-in-one AI platform that gives you access to GPT-4, Gemini AI, Meta AI, and more for life. It costs $39.99 per year. You can generate over 800,000 words, research over 1,900 keywords, create 161 images, remove 24 backgrounds, transcribe 4,833 seconds of audio, and translate PDFs.

articles.title: Institute develops AI that can reduce traffic incidents
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: Software Technology Institute used 4 million pieces of data recorded in the Sardina database to train the AI-based image recognition model and gradually enhance the model's accuracy. The institute is a research unit of the government-sponsored Institute for Information Industry and uses artificial intelligence to identify various types of objects.

articles.title: DOUBLING Data Center Chips Every 90 Days for AI Industrial Flywheel
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: XAI has taken tripled the growth rate of AI data center compute. It is about 3-5 times faster than competitors. Coherent shared memory has been achieved with 200,000 Nvidia H100/H200 chips. By 2030, there could be multiple 10 gigawatt data centers, 100 million cars and Teslabots with AI5/AI6/AI7 chips.

articles.title: Artificial assistance: AI generates simple recipes
articles.author: Maddie Coppel
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI chatbot that can create recipes based on a user's request. Anna Rutherford uses ChatGPT for recipe inspiration and meal prepping. Jamie Ward, an assistant professor at the University of Toledo, believes AI will have a bigger impact in the food industry as it becomes more advanced.

articles.title: Future AI Firms: Navigating a Copyable Landscape
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: The concept of an 'all-AI company' is gaining traction. Dwarkesh Patel explains the advantages and disadvantages of AI in an essay published on Jan. 31. The key takeaways are: Identify tasks that can be automated to improve efficiency and reduce costs. Shift human capital towards strategic roles that require creativity and focus on emotional intelligence. Invest in AI systems responsibly.

articles.title: NVIDIA Stock Surge: Exploring the Impact of AI, Quantum Computing, and Emerging Tech Innovations
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Archyde interviews Dr. Stephen Wozniak, Chief technology Officer at NVIDIA about the company's groundbreaking work in artificial intelligence, quantum computing, and their expanding horizons into autonomous vehicles and the metaverse. Dr. Woznieak believes that NVIDIA is at the forefront of technological revolution.

articles.title: Can AI help Fresno police do their jobs? Why it could be good and why many are skeptical
articles.author: Thaddeus Miller
articles.summary: Fresno is one of the first and largest U.S. cities to use artificial intelligence to write police reports informed by officers' body-worn cameras. Civil rights groups and defense attorneys are concerned about the use of AI in police reports. The department has been using the First Draft program for almost a year.

articles.title: Need to attend a meeting, order groceries or book a flight? There's an 'AI agent' for that
articles.author: Angela Yang
articles.summary: As big tech developers race to roll out the next generation of artificial intelligence, some people are already enlisting an army of AI helpers to check off their daily to-do lists. Last month, OpenAI introduced an AI agent called Operator that it advertised as capable of using the web to complete tasks like filling out forms and ordering groceries. Salesforce introduced a platform that allows businesses to create their own AI agents. Google on Wednesday announced the launch of an AI co-scientist.

articles.title: MiQuest.ai Launches AI-Enhanced Personalized Skincare Solutions for All Skin Types
articles.summary: MiQuest.ai has launched AI-enhanced personalized skincare solutions. The launch marks a significant shift away from generic products and towards science-backed, prescription-grade treatments tailored to each individual's skin type and concerns. The technology has already helped countless users achieve clearer, healthier skin.

articles.title: Young Coders Are Using AI for Everything, Giving "Blank Stares" When Asked How Programs Actually Work
articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.summary: Namanyay Goel is critical of the use of AI in programming. He thinks it's too tempting of a crutch for new coders. AI can be useful, but it doesn't force them to think through the problems they are solving. AI may be more useful in the future, but not now.

articles.title: How delusional is it possible to be about AI?
articles.summary: Starmer's aide has been quoted saying that on AI "the UK needs to move forward and seize the opportunity of not being Europe". AI can be useful in automating data collection and aggregation processes, but it's beyond delusional to imagine that it's going to transform the economy so dramatically that within ten years every single worker is going to become more productive than the most productive worker in the world today. The creative industry was worth £124.6 billion to the UK economy in Gross Added Value to 2022.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can help you save money, according to some studies.    for more information on this topic visit: http://www.pinterest.com/news/personal-finance/can-artificial-intelligence-help-you-save-money.

ASML is the only company in the world with the technology to make cutting-edge chips. Both stocks are trading at a discount to their normal value.

articles.author: Robert Terry
articles.summary: I wrote a series of articles on machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) which began on November 18, 2024. This article is a continuation of my articles published on January 15, 2025 through February 18, 2025. Since I began these articles, there have been no events reported in the worldwide news to date, which contradicts the information reported within any of my publications. Since February 19, 2025, CISA and the FBI said attackers deploying Ghost ransomware have breached victims from multiple industry sectors across over 70 countries including the US.

articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is on the rise in Saskatchewan. People are benefiting from it there, but people should be wary of it, according to people working with the technology.   in Saskatoon, people benefit from it, but should be aware of it.

articles.title: iOS 18.3 Is Out, but Don't Miss These iOS 18.2 Features on Your iPhone
articles.author: Zachary McAuliffe
articles.summary: Apple released iOS 18.2 in December. It brought a host of new AI features to iPhones, including Genmoji, Visual Intelligence and ChatGPT integrated into Siri. Even if you don't have one of the new iPhones, you get new features like an updated Mail app and more.

articles.title: iOS 18.3 Is Out, but Don't Miss These iOS 18.2 Features on Your iPhone

articles.summary: Apple released iOS 18.2 in December. It brought a host of new AI features to iPhones, including Genmoji, Visual Intelligence and ChatGPT integrated into Siri. Even if you don't have one of the new iPhones, you get new features like an updated Mail app and more.

articles.title: Netflix under fire for recreating murder victim's voice with AI
articles.author: Murjani Rawls
articles.summary: Netflix is under fire for using AI to recreate the voice of murdered travel vlogger Gabby Petito. Filmmakers Julia Willoughby Nason and Michael Gasparro got permission from Petito's family to use her voice. Netflix has previously used AI to reanimate voices or alter pictures.

articles.title: OpenAI researcher says soft skills aren't going anywhere
articles.author: Sarah Perkel
articles.summary: Karina Nguyen left engineering for research at OpenAI after watching Claude get better at coding. She believes soft skills will remain important even as work changes. She expects AI to automate'redundant tasks for people' in the future. She would like to be a writer or a museum conservator in such a future.

articles.title: AI may be coming for your job: Michael Weidokal
articles.author: Guest Columnist
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is here to stay and will be one of the most transformative technological changes in human history. The economic impact of the spread of AI has already begun to be felt on the U.S. economy. Businesses will increasingly use AI agents to automate many jobs, eliminating millions of positions in the United States in the process.

articles.title: 50 Hilariously Unlikely Photos That Couldn't Be Recreated Even If You Tried A Million Times
articles.author: Mike Spohr
articles.summary: In the age of AI, fake photos can be faked, but this doesn't stop us from enjoying authentic, honest-to-goodness "what are the odds of that?" photos that are guaranteed to make you laugh. The photos include a woman at an Apple demo, a double gravestone, a photo of a shirtless dude looking like a beautiful bride, two cars with "wayward" written on them, an onion ring mistaken for an engagement ring and a lens flare with Cartman from South Park.

articles.title: Sault Ste. Marie city council to consider banning Chinese AI chatbot
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: Sault Ste. Marie City Council will consider blocking the Chinese AI chatbot, DeepSeek, from city devices and networks at its Monday meeting. The council will consider a motion at its meeting to look into blocking the chatbot at the meeting on Monday.

articles.title: Here's how Walmart and Amazon will use AI to dominate the marketplace
articles.author: William Gittins
articles.summary: Walmart and Amazon are investing heavily in artificial intelligence. President Trump signed an executive order on AI. Walmart will expand the use of an AI-powered coding assistant following positive impact in 2024. Amazon is planning to invest more than $100 billion in 2025, much of which will be AI-related.

articles.title: 6 things I had no idea Google Gemini AI chatbot could do
articles.author: Nick Todorov
articles.summary: Gemini is a Google's AI chatbot. It's preloaded on some of the best Android phones. It can read blurry text with 90% accuracy and create a shopping list in Google Keep notes. It also provides editing suggestions and flags mistakes in text and documents.

articles.title: Got $5,000? 2 Top Growth Stocks to Buy That Could Double Your Money.
articles.author: John Ballard
articles.summary: Micron Technology is one of the leading suppliers of high-performance dynamic random access memory (DRAM) and non-volatile memory (NAND) products. Applied Digital is a relatively small company that focuses on building, designing and operating data centers. The company reported a 51% year-over-year increase in revenue last quarter.

articles.title: AI-driven blood analysis may spur cancer detection, Hong Kong prenatal test pioneer says
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: AI helps researchers recognise patterns in the gene fragments they find in blood plasma. Professor Dennis Lo Yuk-ming's team developed an in-house AI system based on the Convolutional Neural Network. The company also incorporated the transformer neural network architecture into the system. Lo's team is developing tests for the early detection of cancers.

articles.title: Meta to expand India operations, boost hiring in AI, engineering
articles.author: Madhyamam
articles.summary: Technology giant Meta is strengthening its presence in India with plans to hire engineers and product specialists in artificial intelligence (AI) roles. The company owns Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.   It is also a major player in the field of artificial intelligence and machine learning.

articles.title: Scientists Tested AI For Cognitive Decline. The Results Were a Shock.
articles.author: Mike McRae
articles.summary: ChatGPT has been available for public use for two years. It's one of the most advanced AI chatbots. Neurologists from Israel found that large language models (LLMs) suffer from cognitive decline similar to neurodegenerative processes in the human brain. They performed poorly on visuospatial and executive function measures.

articles.title: Students urged to use Al as a bridge to connect past to future
articles.author: Ghana Business News
articles.summary: Dr Wilberforce Sefakor Dzisah urges students of Keta Senior High Technical School (Ketasco) to use Artificial Intelligence (AI) as a bridge to connect the past to the future for better development and quality education delivery. AI can help students develop competencies in fields such as coding, data science and interactive simulation.

articles.title: Two founders built a jobs board for Al agents. Humans need not apply — but their skills are still required.
articles.author: Effie Webb
articles.summary: A new job board for AI agents was created by Polish developers Kamil Stanuch and Łukasz Wróbel as an experiment. It's a small-scale side hustle with around a dozen listings, including a podcast editor, SEO researcher, and contract lawyer. The developers acknowledge the limitations of AI agents.

articles.title: Meta to expand India operations, hire more for engineering and AI roles
articles.author: The Siasat Daily
articles.summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, has announced a new office in India. It will hire engineers and product specialists for artificial intelligence (AI) roles. It is expanding its presence in India and would hire engineers for AI-related roles in the new office.

articles.title: Alarming Cuts Threaten US AI Safety Institute: A Setback for Regulation?
articles.author: Bitcoin World
articles.summary: The world of artificial intelligence is advancing at breakneck speed and the need for robust safety measures and ethical guidelines is more critical than ever. Institutions designed to safeguard AI are facing problems that will impact the government's capacity to research and address critical AI safety concerns.

articles.title: DFI Capital and the AI Revolution: How Artificial Intelligence Is Transforming Trading
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing the financial industry. The integration of AI-powered tools has led to faster trade execution, advanced risk management, and data-driven forecasting. High-frequency trading (HFT) strategies were once limited to major institutions, are now accessible to retail investors. DFI Capital uses AI to enhance returns while maintaining risk control.

articles.title: Thread by @lordasado on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: I made an interactive generative art piece using Grok 3 on my iPhone without writing a single line of code. Grok can offer creative suggestions on how to tweak the simulation further. It's possible to make an art installation like this without code now.

articles.title: 'Stop AI' organization protest outside OpenAI headquarters
articles.author: KTVU Staff
articles.summary: Stop AI held a demonstration outside tech company OpenAI on Saturday afternoon. Three protesters were arrested for trespassing. The group is worried about the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI) technology. There are also calls for further investigation into the death of former OpenAI employee and whistleblower Sunchir Balaji.

articles.title: Investors hope Nvidia will give markets much needed cheer
articles.author: Charley Blaine
articles.summary: A year ago, chipmaker Nvidia was riding high. It had become ground zero for artificial intelligence. Now it has transformed itself from a maker of computer chips used for computer gaming into something more profound: it had become the maker of chips for computer AI.

articles.title: AI opens 'endless' doors for fashion models, closes others
articles.author: Lucie LEQUIER
articles.summary: Alexsandrah Gondora uses artificial intelligence to create a digital double of herself for photo shoots. The technology is already used by brands to create visual imagery for e-commerce websites and customised advertising campaigns at a lower cost. Critics fear AI will render many professionals obsolete and promote an artificial standard of beauty.

articles.title: AI opens 'endless' doors for fashion models, closes others
articles.author: Lucie LEQUIER
articles.summary: Alexsandrah Gondora has an AI replica of herself that helps her to be in two places at the same time thanks to the power of being in touch with both of them at once, thanks to an artificial intelligence program.

articles.title: Three arrested in S.F. after protesting AI technology outside OpenAI headquarters
articles.author: Catherine Ho
articles.summary: A protest outside the San Francisco headquarters of OpenAI on Saturday led to three arrests after protestors refused to move from the company's property onto the sidewalk. About two dozen people demonstrated to stop the development of better-than-human AI. The demonstration also called for the FBI to investigate the death of Suchir Balaji, the former OpenAI engineer who was found dead from a gunshot wound inside his San Francisco apartment in November.

articles.title: Top author Louis warns: We cannot allow AI to run riot
articles.author: The Daily Mail
articles.summary: Louis de Bernieres is a best-selling author. He backs the Mail's campaign to stop the UK's creative industries being exploited by tech giants. He warns that unchecked artificial intelligence (AI) may 'run riot' in society as he backs the campaign.

articles.title: Will AI replace journalists? A talk with AI researcher
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is reshaping content creation, journalism, and even our daily interactions. articles.title: ‘Humans will always be ahead of AI'

articles.title: Marin nonprofit offers free AI training for older residents
articles.author: Keri Brenner
articles.summary: Susan Gonzales, a former tech executive, started a nonprofit website called 'AI and You' to help older people learn about artificial intelligence programs. Jennifer Engstrom, 63, found the website helpful to her as a caregiver, as it includes information about AI home technology and wearable devices.

articles.title: Tech Trends In Higher Ed: Redefining Enrollment, Engagement & Success
articles.author: Rhett Power
articles.summary: Emerging tech in higher education is helping institutions meet their enrollment goals and redefine their student success strategies. AI-powered CRM systems can anticipate student needs, tailor communications, and strengthen connections throughout the enrollment and academic journey. Data analytics tools are enabling institutions to make more informed decisions that directly impact academic and operational success.

articles.title: AI And The End Of Traditional Work: Are We Entering A Post-Work Era?
articles.author: Sherzod Odilov
articles.summary: By 2030, automation could displace 400 million to 800 million jobs worldwide, according to McKinsey study. Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, has said that AI will handle 95% of what marketers use agencies, strategists, and creative professionals for today. Elon Musk has said jobs are going to go away, full stop.

articles.title: AI Transforming Bahrain's Labor Market: Experts Highlight Urgent Need for Workforce Upskilling
articles.author: bizbahrain
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping Bahrain's labor market. There is a need to equip national talent with the skills required to navigate this technological evolution. articles.title: AI software to let job centre staff focus on long-term unemployed
articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: Ministers hope to introduce a'self-serve' AI platform that can prepare and review CVs, write cover letters and help prepare for job interviews. Jobseekers will be told to use artificial intelligence software instead of seeing job centre staff to focus efforts on the long-term unemployed.

articles.summary: Google is testing a new AI feature to generate passwords for compromised accounts through artificial intelligence. articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to influence democratic processes in Africa. Deepfakes, cheap fakes and fake news are all weapons that can be produced cheaply and endlessly. Citizens should be aware of this and take steps to protect themselves from fake news and fake information.

articles.summary: People who rely on artificial intelligence (AI) tools at work are losing their mental capabilities in return. The study was conducted by Microsoft's AI developer Copilot and Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) and found that people are taking the easy way out by making AI tools think for them.

articles.title: Optical illusion: Only those with high IQ minds can find the human among statues in 5 seconds
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: IQ tests are used to measure cognitive skills, problem-solving, and mental acuity. The tests measure the logical thinking, pattern recognition, memory, and analytical mind of an individual. IQ itself is just a measure of one's intelligence, but the tests are commonly used to assess intelligence.

articles.title: As AI kicks in graduates in Israel struggle to find tech jobs
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: Tech companies have cut back on hiring juniors as AI is already quicker, cheaper and more accurate in writing code than computer science grads.      .   "The Globes" is on the front page of the Globes.

articles.title: OpenAI researcher says soft skills aren't going anywhere
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Karina Nguyen left engineering for research after watching Claude get better at coding in a previous role at Anthropic. She thinks creativity and emotional intelligence are some of the hardest things to teach AI. The dream of any AI research is to automate AI research, she says.

articles.title: The AI mess
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is polluting the web with bogus images and data that are often more convincing than reality, says the writer. Read the full article here.   Â     ...  .   »   "Artificial inteligence pollutes the web"

articles.title: Can AI help Fresno police do their jobs? Why it could be good and why ...
articles.author: Fresno Bee
articles.summary: Chief Mindy Casto says artificial intelligence is already saving time for police officers. She says it's already possible for officers to work more effectively.      Â   in less than a decade, according to Mindy casto.

articles.title: Whisk away!
articles.author: Manila Bulletin
articles.summary: Whisk is a fun and engaging tool that makes AI images. It's the latest experiment that explores the capabilities of gen AI and follows the success of Google's AI tools. It lets users create unique content using AI.      Â

articles.title: AI can accentuate Oman's developmental plans
articles.author: Oman Observer
articles.summary: Incorporating Oman's developmental plans through the five-year plans and the vision 2040 with Artificial Intelligence can accentuate the speed of bringing in results and concomitantly improve Oman's development.      .   in the 5th and 20th plans.

articles.title: Senior Pentagon Official: New Plan Is to Invest in "Autonomous Killer Robots"
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Pentagon is looking to move away from funding research on autonomous killer robots, according to a senior defense official. The official doesn't know what "artificial intelligence" means, but the Pentagon is not going to be investing in it any more.

articles.title: China's Alibaba to invest $50 bn in AI, cloud computing
articles.author: ADEK BERRY
articles.summary: Alibaba will spend $50 billion on artificial intelligence and cloud computing over the next three years. Its shares have soared to three-year highs since the start of the year. Jack Ma was seen meeting President Xi Jinping last week, a week after the company's co-founder Jack Ma met with investors.
